page.title: 02Fishing on Coll
page.content: Most Fishermen on Coll are part-time with a few exceptions.The most common catch are velvet crabs and lobsters. July,August and September are the best months for fishing. Most fishermen use homemade creels but a few use commercially produced ones. Mackerel,saithe,liath,are caught mainly to use as bait in creels. The fishing on Coll depends greatly on the weather and the state on the tide.Most of the boats range from fourteen foot to twenty-four foot.Most fishermen have outboard engines but some have inboards.There is one boat with an inboard-outboard engine.Two people have pot-haulers(winches for creels).Most boats have names but some have registration numbers.
